headline: Subpoenaing Trump's phone records now 'up for discussion': Bennie Thompson
author: Matthew Chapman
sentences:
There might have been some other people in the room who heard conversations during that day.\u201d\n\n@BennieGThompson tonight
— Robert Costa (@Robert Costa) 1648679245
This comes after reports that there is a 7 hour and 37 minute gap in White House phone records currently held by the committee, leaving open the question of what the former president was discussing during that time and with whom.

"There might have been some other people in the room who heard conversations during that day.”
\u201cThere are some other options we have which I can't tell you right now that we\u2019ll look at and try to pull it together.

On Wednesday, according to CBS' Zak Hudak and Robert Costa, House January 6 Committee Chair Bennie Thompson (D-MS) said that issuing a subpoena for former President Donald Trump's phone records is "up for discussion."
“There are some other options we have which I can't tell you right now that we’ll look at and try to pull it together," Thompson explained.
Some Republicans who spoke with Trump that day, including Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), have evaded reporter questions about what was discussed.
However, noted Costa, Thompson said that there are potentially other ways the committee has to obtain the records.
